adjective &amp; adverb.description: Facing the wind or on the side facing the wind.
examples: the windward side of the boat

noun.description: The side or direction from which the wind is blowing.
examples: the ships drifted west, leaving the island quite a distance to windward

phrases: I happen to have got to windward of the young woman
But I'm not going to play the fool; honor bright, I'm not; yet - by Jove! - to get to windward of the professors and Mackenzie too!
